a small constellation (= a group of stars) said to look like a pair of weighing scales: Gliese 581 is a star in the constellation Libra.
[ C or U ] the seventh sign of the zodiac, relating to the period 23 September to 22 October , represented by a pair of weighing scales, or a person born during this period: If your birthday is at the end of September, your zodiac sign is Libra. My sister is a Libra.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a red dwarf star in the constellation Libra that the planet orbits every 13 days.The chief stars of Libra are Beta or Zubenelchemale, Alpha or Zubenelgenubi and Sigma or Zubenalgubi.This is typical of those born under the star sign Libra.My daughter says I can't make up my mind because I'm a Libra.
